body.p:
H. C. Ezekiel. S. Bernheim.
Office of Ezekiel & Co.
Auctioneers and Commission Merchants
No's. 19 & 21 West Pearl Street.

It is not often that I allow
you interesting favours to remain so long un-
answered, but it seems that I have had such
an amount of correspondence to combat
with that I at times get tired writing.

As usual I read your last with much
pleasure, for I know full well your head and
heart is with our cause, and I cannot ex-
pect you to use any influence with your
congregation other than to speak a good
word when needed. Whilst I was in Phila
I could see pretty well how congregational
affairs drifted where the expenditure of money
would be involved, hence I see precisely the
attitude you are placed in regard to making
any suggestion that may tend embarrassing
to the finances of your congregation, my
main aim is to try and have the Eastern
Preparatory Schools or Trades for the College
proper, located at Philadelphia, instead of
New York, as Phila for its quietude is better adapted,
and I know you would be in your element
to accomplish that towards our union and college
that you have always preferred; and again,
whilst you do not seek any pecuniary advantage
for your labour in the love of teaching. I would
desire to make it advantageous to you (notwithstan
ding your present ideas, however, all this will
be a topic for further consideration, but as
a matter of course, if you were to tender
your services particularly for the first year or
longer, as Dr Wise has done, it might prove as
a Stimulus to locate the Auxillary at Phila,
rather than to pay a large salary to any one
in New York. Now in regard to the fruit
we may reap from our labours, it is indeed
a hard matter to say, we are doing our best
here, for the advancement of Judaism, our
pupils are taught according to the standard
of all Jewish institutions, neither Dr Wise or
Dr Lilienthal do not advance their ideas
in contravention to the established opinions
as laid down in our standard works, we
are honest and can do no more, I can say
truly from what I have seen and heard at
the classes: that the minds of the students are
not biased or hampered in any way, they
are taught the mishnah as it is, and when
they arrive at a mature age, they can
form their own opinions, and make their
own deductions, can we do any more?

We must all candidly admit that the minds
of this generation have undergone a great
a great change, they were understated
that the mere farces and ceremonies and
the antiquated tunes and Synagogue formula,
does not constitute religion, do we not know
men who violate the sanctity of the Sabbath &
festivals, and would not eat a chicken if
it was not killed in accordance with our
custom, I could cite hundreds of these petty
things that is so strenuously adhered to, as one
of the most important points of religion.

In regard to the Eastern journal's advocacy
of the Heb. Union College now established
here, and the Union of Congregations, they
are all right on these questions, as you
can notice, they all publish our weekly
reports of the union. Your views in regard
to a professor for the higher grades are cor-
rect, we must abide our time.

Dr Wise is all right, you will find him as
conservative as needs be. I have been with
day after day, he is as orthodox as the
times we live in will well permit.

The Dr tells me that it is rather doubtful
that he will be at our next convention in
Phila either as a delegate or visitor, he
does not work to prevent a free expression of sen-
timent at the convention if the Board
of Delegates is merged into the Union and
the [?] Eastern Congregations join the
union, which will be the sequel, he
told me the other day, that if there be
a union of the north-south east & west,
his desire will then be accomplished and
he will be willing to be superceded, in
this he is honest. I can assure you,
but it is my opinion, that if there be
a union complete, that Dr Wise will
be the only one that will be selected
for the head. Notwithstanding the great
opposition that has been made to him,
Oh! I am tired writing and must
now close, hoping this may meet all
in health, with love from all to dear
Nina and best wishes to your dear self

I remain, as ever
Truly &c
Jacob Ezekiel
